content.description: This second route from the right on the Scoop Wall in between Scoop Deville and English Body.  Dissappointingly easy climb up the steep wall.  An okay warmup but seemed like more of a waste of good bolts to me as it was really squeezed in between the existing routes.I will give it one star because I am sure that some people will like this as a nice easy pleasant little sportclimb.
content.protection: 5 or 6 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.

climbs.name: Scoop Deville
climbs.fa: Glenn Schuler, Rick Westbay, & Mark Milligan

content.description:
Find this route as being the center of the 5 existing routes sport routes on this wall. It has 5 bolts and 5 cruxes all in the 10 range with good rests in between. The bolts on this climb always seem a bit far apart. It has super cool climbing over the bulges and waves in the wall on excellent, highly featured granite using a variety of different techniques. This route gets 3 stars for pure fun.

This is a really great place to come and do several short really cool sport routes in the hard 10 to easy 11 range. This faces south, so it has nice sun. There are good routes on the "Springer Gulch" wall if you want more routes.

This is the farthest route to the right on the "Scoop Wall".  The first bolt is about 25 feet off the ground.  Climb to the bolt using gear for pro if you desire.  Up through interesting and varied terrain past several bolts. I remember wanting a small Alien for one of the lower cruxes.  I do not know what the intent of the first ascent was but where the bolts ended I climbed on trad gear through an excellent right facing roof flake thingy.  This could be as hard as 10a but protects really well with a #1 Friend.  Continue on up past this and belay at a nice tree with a great veiw of the beautiful canyon.  Walk off easiler to the climbers right.  I really liked this route as it has a very old school feel to it and the rock is friendly, rough, beautiful granite.

[Eds.  Note, this route was originally entered in this database as English Body.  Given the below comment, the name was changed to possibly the original name.]
content.protection: This route has about 5 or 6 bolts but I brought a rack and used several pieces from small to mid-range.  [Eds. This apparently was led with traditional protection without the bolts.]

climbs.name: Crest of the Wave
climbs.fa: Mark Milligan, Rick Westbay, & Glenn Schuler

content.description: This is the farthest left route of the 5 on the "Scoop Wall"  Climb over the fantastic roof (crux) up the wild, wavy wall over the roof and on to the anchors. It is a super fun route on wild featured granite.  Do it!!!!
content.protection: Several bolts plus a couple of small pieces.

climbs.name: Body English
climbs.fa: Mark Milligan, Rick Westbay, & Glenn Schuler

content.description:
This is the second in from the left of the 5 routes on the "Scoop Wall". This route really requires some intense "Body English".  Climb the desperate bulge layback kind of thing to the huge jug (crux).  I have always found this to be really desperate, strenuous, and reachy. I've done it a couple of time and then not been able to do it at all other times.  Up the wall past wild wavy chickenhead kind of things over the roof to the 2 bolt anchor.

Very Very cool route.
content.protection: 4 bolts plus a few small pieces.
